data_sources.data_quality_notes: Comprehensive research conducted 2025-10-11. Data verified from multiple authoritative sources including PG&E program pages, CPUC Resolution E-4020, and OpenADR technical documentation.

capacity_rate.value: CPUC-approved rates vary by month, highest July-September
capacity_rate.notes: Monthly capacity payments for nominated load commitment. Rates authorized by CPUC through 2027. Specific rates listed in Schedule E-CBP tariff. Aggregators receive 100% of capacity payment; directly enrolled customers receive 80%.

performance_rate.calculation: Based on natural gas city gate price with 15,000 BTU/kWh trigger heat rate
performance_rate.notes: Energy payments paid to aggregators for actual event curtailment. Paid for up to 150% of nominated demand reduction. Zero payment if no events called during month.

seasons.max_events: Not specified - market-driven based on CAISO PDR awards

customer_classes.size_threshold_notes: No minimum demand load requirement. All customer classes eligible including residential, commercial, industrial, and agricultural rate schedules.

resource_types: Energy storage (indirect participation through load reduction)
eligibility.aggregator_participation: Optional - customers can enroll directly with PG&E or through third-party aggregators
eligibility.meter_requirements: Interval meter (MV90 or SmartMeterâ„¢) capable of recording usage in 15-minute intervals with remote reading capability by PG&E
ineligible_customers: Customers receiving power from WAPA or other 3rd parties (not DA/CCA)

duration_options: 1-4 hour events (CBP Elect - current PG&E option)
event_parameters.typical_response_time_minutes: Not specified - day-ahead notification allows preparation

notification.notification_recipient: Aggregators notified by PG&E; aggregators then notify enrolled customers

event_triggers.trigger_description: CBP Events are triggered when PG&E receives a market award from the CAISO for a Proxy Demand Resource (PDR) that is part of CBP, as a result of the offer price specified by the aggregator for a nominated portfolio. Underlying market driver is typically high wholesale energy prices corresponding to natural gas city gate price at 15,000 BTU/kWh heat rate threshold.
event_triggers.primary_trigger: CAISO market award for PDR based on aggregator bid price
secondary_triggers: Natural gas price thresholds (15,000 BTU/kWh heat rate)
event_triggers.price_threshold: Trigger heat rate: 15,000 BTU/kWh based on natural gas city gate price

nomination_bidding.nomination_deadline: 5 days before start of operating month
nomination_bidding.bidding_process: Aggregators submit offer prices to CAISO for nominated portfolios as Proxy Demand Resources (PDR). Events triggered when CAISO awards market capacity based on bids. CBP Elect option allows aggregators to set bid prices that determine event dispatch.
nomination_bidding.bidding_timeline: Day-ahead market participation through CAISO PDR mechanism

penalties.penalty_structure: Tiered penalty system based on performance shortfall. Aggregators penalized for failing to deliver committed load reductions. Participants penalized at $6.00/kWh for energy usage over Firm Service Level (FSL) during curtailment. Performance below 50% of nominated reduction triggers proportional penalties. Performance between 50-89.99% receives reduced or zero capacity payments but avoids additional penalties. Any hour with performance below Minimum Delivered Capacity counts as zero for that hour.

penalty_thresholds.consequence: Penalty equal to shortfall percentage applied to capacity payment (e.g., 40% shortfall = 40% penalty)
Penalty based on kWh shortfall (historical reference)

penalty_thresholds.threshold: Usage above Firm Service Level during event

historical_events.notes: PG&E provides monthly reports to CPUC containing CBP event data including estimated load impacts, list of demand response events called, and program expenditures. Specific 2023-2024 event frequency data available in CPUC Demand Response Monthly Reports.

api_protocols: PG&E Share My Data API (for usage data)

technical_requirements.communication_protocol: OpenADR 2.0 standard for bidirectional communication between utility (VTN) and aggregator/customer (VEN)
technical_requirements.interval_data_access: 15-minute interval meter data via Share My Data API
technical_requirements.historical_data_availability: Up to 48 months of historical interval usage data
technical_requirements.meter_reprogramming: Authorization allows PG&E to change meter to shorter interval length if necessary

aggregator_support.direct_enrollment_option: Customers can enroll directly with PG&E or through aggregators
aggregator_support.aggregator_responsibilities: Design DR program, submit monthly nominations, receive event notifications, manage customer portfolios, bid into CAISO market

integration_metadata.notes: Comprehensive program information verified from multiple authoritative sources. Payment rates authorized through 2027 but specific dollar amounts require tariff document review. Program integrated with CAISO wholesale markets through PDR mechanism. Strong technical documentation available through OpenADR Alliance. API integrations well-established for automated participation.

caiso_integration.settlement_timeline: Utilities pay aggregators within 30-60 days after operating month end
caiso_integration.notes: CBP resources participate in CAISO markets as PDRs. Aggregators submit offer prices for nominated portfolios. Events triggered when CAISO awards market capacity. Program coordinates with CAISO's wholesale energy market operations.

program_history.purpose: Replace California Power Authority Demand Reserves Partnership

related_programs.emergency_load_reduction_program: CBP aggregators eligible for ELRP participation
related_programs.automated_demand_response: Integration with OpenADR enables automated participation
